definition: home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very

to return/to go back to/to give back to/(of a responsibility) to be taken care of by/to belong to/to gather together/(used between two identical verbs) despite/to marry (of a woman) (old)/division on the abacus with a one-digit divisor

sentences.english: We were bombed out during the Anti-Japanese War.
sentences.chinese: 抗戰期間我們被炸得無家可歸。

sentences.english: Not too many for the millions of homeless.
sentences.chinese: 沒有太多的給那些數百萬無家可歸的人。

sentences.english: I found myself homeless and alone.
sentences.chinese: 我發先自己無依無靠，無家可歸。

sentences.english: Many homeless people were living here.
sentences.chinese: 很多無家可歸的人住在這裏。

sentences.english: Many of the displaced are sheltering in schools.
sentences.chinese: 許多無家可歸的人現在在學校暫時棲身。

sentences.english: The typhoon, referred to locally as Milenyo, caused floods and landslides that have displaced some 5,500 people.
sentences.chinese: 颱風造成的水災和塌方使大約5500人無家可歸。

sentences.english: I can't leave because if I leave I'd be homeless.
sentences.chinese: 我不能離開，如果我離開就無家可歸了。

sentences.english: Ignoring a homeless person who asks for money.
sentences.chinese: 街上一個無家可歸的人向你要錢，你揚長而去。

sentences.english: I couldnt help it but cry and cried as I became homeless.
sentences.chinese: 我不能幫助它而哭，哭了，當我變得無家可歸。

sentences.english: Benedict recalled the plight of "street children who do not have the blessing of a family home."
sentences.chinese: 教皇提醒信徒不要忘記那些無家可歸的流浪兒的處境。

sentences.english: Send these, the homeless, tempest-tossed to me.
sentences.chinese: 送過來吧這些無家可歸的，四處漂泊的的人。

sentences.english: Since his parents died of illness, he has been homeless.
sentences.chinese: 自從他的父母病故以來，他就一直無家可歸。

sentences.english: When people left homeless when a night shelter to promote social harmony.
sentences.chinese: 當別人無家可歸的時候，一晚借宿能促進社會的和諧。

sentences.english: The homeless child dematerialized into the night.
sentences.chinese: 那個無家可歸的孩子消失在夜幕之中。

sentences.english: The floods left many people destitute.
sentences.chinese: 洪水讓許多人缺衣少食，無家可歸。

sentences.english: My love of to dight finds no home in the nest deserted by yesterday's love.
sentences.chinese: 於昨日之愛拋棄的巢穴中，我的本日之愛無家可歸。

definition: destitute and homeless (idiom); forced from one's home and wandering about/displaced
to leave one's native place, esp. against one's will (idiom)
(saying) to be very scared and on edge
to have enough food and warm clothes/adequately provided
